Name: Enterprise Software Categorization
Description: A placeholder to discuss, track & log our decision regarding software domain and capabilities

Name: Domain – API & Integration Tools
Description: Tools enabling API design, testing, documentation, and system-to-system integration.

Name: Capability – API Design & Modeling
Description: Tools to design, map, and document API structures. Examples: Swagger, Stoplight.

Name: Capability – API Testing & Validation
Description: Tools for validating API functionality and correctness. Examples: Postman, SoapUI.

Name: Capability – API Mocking / Sandbox
Description: Tools that simulate API behavior for testing or development. Examples: WireMock, Mockoon.

Name: Capability – API Documentation / Spec Management
Description: Tools managing API documentation and specifications. Examples: OpenAPI, SwaggerHub.

Name: Capability – Integration / Messaging / Middleware Tools
Description: Middleware and messaging systems enabling system-to-system communication. Examples: RabbitMQ, MuleSoft.

Name: Domain – Build & CI/CD
Description: Tools that automate building, testing, packaging, and delivering software.

Name: Capability – Build Automation
Description: Systems that compile and package applications automatically. Examples: Maven, Gradle, Ant.

Name: Capability – Dependency Management
Description: Tools that handle build-time and runtime library dependencies. Examples: npm, Composer, Ivy.

Name: Capability – Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery
Description: Automated code integration, testing, and deployment pipelines. Examples: Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI.

Name: Capability – Artifact Repository & Release Management
Description: Repositories for storing builds, binaries, and release artifacts. Examples: Nexus, Artifactory.

Name: Capability – Deployment Automation & Configuration
Description: Tools that automate application deployment and environment configuration. Examples: Ansible, Terraform, Octopus Deploy.

Name: Domain – Custom / Internal Applications
Description: Custom-built tools and scripts tailored for internal business processes.

Name: Capability – Internal Business Applications
Description: Business-specific internal software solutions. Examples: ERP, CRM.

Name: Capability – Custom-built Tools & Scripts
Description: In-house utilities built to support workflows. Examples: Python automation scripts, VBA macros.

Name: Capability – Automation / Integration Scripts
Description: Scripts used to automate internal processes. Examples: Jenkins pipelines, shell scripts.

Name: Capability – Internal Data & Metadata Management Tools
Description: Tools used to manage internal datasets or metadata. Examples: Custom SQL dashboards, metadata catalogs.

Name: Capability – Domain-Specific / Business-Specific Tools
Description: Tools designed for niche business use cases. Examples: Lab management software, specialized financial apps.

Name: Domain – Databases & Data Management
Description: Tools that support storage, design, extraction, and transformation of data.

Name: Capability – Database Clients & Admin Tools
Description: Tools used to manage and administer databases. Examples: pgAdmin, SQL Server Management Studio.

Name: Capability – Data Modeling & Schema Design
Description: Tools for designing database schemas and data models. Examples: ER/Studio, dbForge Studio.

Name: Capability – ETL / Data Transformation & Pipelines
Description: Tools for extracting, transforming, and loading data. Examples: Talend, Apache Nifi.

Name: Capability – NoSQL / Document / In-memory Databases
Description: Non-relational databases for high-performance or flexible storage. Examples: MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra.

Name: Capability – Cloud / On-Prem Data Storage Management
Description: Tools for managing structured and unstructured data storage solutions. Examples: AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage.

Name: Domain – Development Tools
Description: Tools that support software development activities including editing, debugging, scripting, and managing dependencies.

Name: Capability – Code Editing / IDE
Description: Tools for writing, navigating, and structuring code efficiently. Examples: Visual Studio, IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse.

Name: Capability – Debugging & Diagnostics
Description: Tools to identify, troubleshoot, and analyze software defects or runtime behavior. Examples: GDB, Chrome DevTools, JetBrains Debugger.

Name: Capability – Scripting / Automation Tools
Description: Tools enabling task automation, workflow scripting, and repetitive action reduction. Examples: PowerShell, Bash, Ansible.

Name: Capability – Language Runtimes / Interpreters
Description: Execution environments for programming languages. Examples: Node.js, Python interpreter, Java JVM.

Name: Capability – Package & Dependency Management
Description: Tools used to install, update, and manage external software dependencies. Examples: npm, Maven, pip.

Name: Domain – Infrastructure & Hosting
Description: Tools enabling cloud, container, virtual, and OS hosting infrastructures.

Name: Capability – Containerization & Container Orchestration
Description: Tools deploying and managing containers and clusters. Examples: Docker, Kubernetes.

Name: Capability – Virtualization & VM Management
Description: Systems managing virtual machines. Examples: VMware vSphere, Hyper-V.

Name: Capability – Cloud CLI / Cloud Resource Management
Description: Tools managing cloud services using CLI or consoles. Examples: AWS CLI, Azure CLI.

Name: Capability – Operating System Platforms & Runtime Environments
Description: OS-level software and runtimes supporting applications. Examples: Linux, Windows Server, Java Runtime.

Name: Capability – Configuration / Deployment / Provisioning Tools
Description: Tools automating infrastructure provisioning and configuration. Examples: Terraform, Ansible, Chef.

Name: Domain – Media, Graphics & Document Processing
Description: Tools for editing, converting, or processing multimedia and documents.

Name: Capability – Image / Graphics Editing Tools
Description: Tools modifying or creating graphical content. Examples: Photoshop, GIMP.

Name: Capability – Vector Graphics / Diagram Tools
Description: Tools creating vector-based diagrams or graphics. Examples: Illustrator, Inkscape.

Name: Capability – PDF Generation / Editing
Description: Tools creating, editing, or converting PDFs. Examples: Adobe Acrobat, PDFsam.

Name: Capability – Media Conversion & Processing Tools
Description: Tools transforming audio, video, or images. Examples: FFmpeg, HandBrake.

Name: Capability – Screen Recording / Video Tools
Description: Tools recording screen activity or creating videos. Examples: OBS Studio, Camtasia.

Name: Domain – Monitoring & Observability
Description: Tools that monitor performance, logs, metrics, and operational health.

Name: Capability – System & Infrastructure Monitoring
Description: Tools supervising system health and resource usage. Examples: Nagios, Zabbix.

Name: Capability – Application Performance Monitoring (APM)
Description: Tools tracking application performance and user behavior. Examples: New Relic, Dynatrace.

Name: Capability – Log Management & Analysis
Description: Tools aggregating, searching, and analyzing logs. Examples: ELK Stack, Splunk.

Name: Capability – Network / Traffic Monitoring & Analysis
Description: Tools tracking network traffic flow and connectivity. Examples: Wireshark, SolarWinds.

Name: Capability – Resource / Disk / Memory / Profiling Tools
Description: Tools evaluating hardware or application resource usage. Examples: Perf, htop, VisualVM.

Name: Domain – Networking & Connectivity
Description: Tools that enable network access, secure connectivity, and traffic control.

Name: Capability – SSH / SFTP / Remote Access Clients
Description: Tools enabling remote command-line and file access. Examples: PuTTY, FileZilla.

Name: Capability – VPN / Remote Access Tools
Description: Tools providing secure network connectivity. Examples: OpenVPN, Cisco AnyConnect.

Name: Capability – Network / Packet Inspection Tools
Description: Tools analyzing or inspecting network traffic. Examples: Wireshark, tcpdump.

Name: Capability – Proxy / Gateway Tools
Description: Tools routing or controlling network access. Examples: Squid Proxy, NGINX.

Name: Capability – Network Configuration & Management Tools
Description: Tools configuring and managing network infrastructure. Examples: NetBox, SolarWinds NCM.

Name: Domain – Office, Collaboration & Productivity
Description: Tools supporting collaboration, documentation, and team productivity.

Name: Capability – Documentation & Wiki Tools
Description: Tools for creating internal documentation. Examples: Confluence, MediaWiki.

Name: Capability – Diagramming / Modeling / Flowchart Tools
Description: Tools for creating diagrams or models. Examples: Lucidchart, Microsoft Visio.

Name: Capability – Knowledge Management Tools
Description: Platforms organizing enterprise knowledge. Examples: Notion, SharePoint.

Name: Capability – Project / Task / Workflow Collaboration Tools
Description: Tools supporting task management and teamwork. Examples: Jira, Trello.

Name: Capability – Office / Productivity Suites
Description: General office applications improving productivity. Examples: Microsoft Office, Google Workspace.

Name: Domain – Security & Identity
Description: Tools that ensure security, access control, and protection of assets.

Name: Capability – Password & Secrets Management
Description: Tools securing credentials, tokens, and secrets. Examples: HashiCorp Vault, LastPass Enterprise.

Name: Capability – Certificate & Key Management
Description: Tools for managing encryption keys and certificates. Examples: AWS KMS, Venafi.

Name: Capability – Authentication / Identity Management
Description: Identity systems supporting user authentication and authorization. Examples: Okta, Keycloak.

Name: Capability – Encryption & Security Hardening Tools
Description: Tools that encrypt data and harden environments. Examples: OpenSSL, CIS-CAT.

Name: Capability – Endpoint / Application Security Tools
Description: Tools that protect applications and endpoints from attacks. Examples: CrowdStrike, Nessus.

Name: Domain – System Utilities & OS Tools
Description: General-purpose utilities supporting system operations and productivity.

Name: Capability – File Management & Explorer Tools
Description: Tools for navigating and managing files. Examples: Windows Explorer, Total Commander.

Name: Capability – File Comparison / Diff & Merge Tools
Description: Tools comparing or merging file contents. Examples: Beyond Compare, Meld.

Name: Capability – Archive / Compression / Packaging Tools
Description: Tools packaging or compressing data. Examples: 7-Zip, WinRAR, tar.

Name: Capability – Terminal / Shell / CLI Tools
Description: Command-line interfaces for system control. Examples: Bash, PowerShell, Terminal.app.

Name: Capability – Automation / Macro / Script execution tools
Description: Tools that automate OS tasks or workflows. Examples: AutoHotkey, Automator.

Name: Domain – Testing & Quality Assurance
Description: Tools ensuring software quality, reliability, and performance.

Name: Capability – Functional Testing
Description: Tools testing business functionality. Examples: Selenium, TestComplete.

Name: Capability – API / Integration Testing
Description: Tools testing APIs and integrated system flows. Examples: Postman, ReadyAPI.

Name: Capability – Performance & Load Testing
Description: Tools evaluating speed, capacity, and scalability. Examples: JMeter, Gatling.

Name: Capability – Security Testing
Description: Tools validating security vulnerabilities. Examples: OWASP ZAP, Burp Suite.

Name: Capability – Test Automation Frameworks
Description: Frameworks automating test execution. Examples: Robot Framework, Cypress.

Name: Capability – Unit / Integration / Regression Testing Tools
Description: Tools enabling granular, integration, and regression tests. Examples: JUnit, NUnit.

Name: Domain – Version Control & Repositories
Description: Tools that manage source code versions, branching, merging, and repository access.

Name: Capability – Distributed Version Control (e.g. Git)
Description: Git-based systems where each user has a full repository clone. Examples: Git, Mercurial.

Name: Capability – Centralized VCS / Legacy SCM
Description: Older systems relying on a central repository. Examples: SVN, Perforce.

Name: Capability – GUI Clients / Repository Browsers
Description: Graphical tools for viewing and managing repositories. Examples: SourceTree, GitKraken.

Name: Capability – Branch & Release Management
Description: Tools supporting branching strategies and release methodology. Examples: Git Flow, GitHub Flow.

Name: Capability – Merge / Diff / Conflict Resolution Tools
Description: Tools that compare code and assist with conflict resolution. Examples: Beyond Compare, KDiff3.
